      • setParent

        public void setParent(Entity parent)
        Description copied from interface: Entity
        Updates the parent of this entity.
        This method makes sure that the old and the new parent keep their entities list updated, by automatically calling Entity.addEntity(Entity) and Entity.removeEntity(Entity).

        A CoreNotificationCodes.ENTITY_PARENT_CHANGED notification is thrown.
        Additionally, each descendant of this entity (ie: entities who have this entity as their direct or not direct parent) are notified using CoreNotificationCodes.ENTITY_ANCESTOR_CHANGED.

        Specified by:
        setParent in interface Entity
        Overrides:
        setParent in class RunnableEntityImpl

      • addEntity

        public void addEntity(Entity entity)
        Description copied from interface: Entity
        Adds a new children entity.
        This does not update the parent of the given entity.

        Note: You should not need to call this method, instead use EntityImpl.setParent(Entity).

        Specified by:
        addEntity in interface Entity
        Overrides:
        addEntity in class EntityImpl

      • doCancel

        public void doCancel()
        Description copied from interface: RunnableEntity
        Stops the entity's activity and declares it as canceled.

        If this entity owns RunnableEntity children, then they must also be canceled.

        Nothing is done if this entity is already terminated (if RunnableEntity.isTerminated() returns true).

        Specified by:
        doCancel in interface RunnableEntity

      • doFail

        public void doFail()
        Description copied from interface: RunnableEntity
        Stops the entity's activity and declares it as failed.

        If this entity owns RunnableEntity children, then they must also be declared as failed.

        Nothing is done if this entity is already terminated (if RunnableEntity.isTerminated() returns true).

        Specified by:
        doFail in interface RunnableEntity

      • doPause

        public abstract void doPause()
        Pauses the current operation. These basic steps are taken:
        • Frees the allocated resource on each Provisioner that is related to this operation;
        • Updates this operation state and discards any scheduled event during operation activation;
        • Updates total completed length, and sets the operation state to RunnableEntity.RunnableState.COMPLETED if needed.
        The new Operation state is set to RunnableEntity.RunnableState.PAUSED or to RunnableEntity.RunnableState.COMPLETED.

        Specified by:
        doPause in interface RunnableEntity
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the operation is not in RunnableEntity.RunnableState.RUNNING state.

      • doRestart

        public abstract void doRestart()
        Description copied from interface: RunnableEntity
        Reinitializes the entity and restarts it from the beginning.

        Use this method to start again an entity after it is terminated. So, unlike RunnableEntity.doStart() this method will not throw an exception if this entity is already terminated.

        Make sure that RunnableEntity.canRestart() returns true before calling this method or you will get an exception.

        If this entity owns RunnableEntity children, then they must be canceled.

        Specified by:
        doRestart in interface RunnableEntity

      • doStart

        public abstract void doStart()
        Activate the current operation. These basic steps are taken:
        • Allocates the wanted resource on each Provisioner that is related to this operation;
        • Updates this operation state and schedules an event for the end of operation to automatically deactivate it when it is completed.
        The new operation state is set to RunnableEntity.RunnableState.RUNNING if successful or to RunnableEntity.RunnableState.FAILED if the operation cannot be activated (example: not enough resources).
        Specified by:
        doStart in interface RunnableEntity
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the operation is terminated (see RunnableEntity.isTerminated()) or if it is already running.

      • doTerminate

        public void doTerminate()
        Will pause the operation and cancel it if it is not completed.
        Specified by:
        doTerminate in interface RunnableEntity

      • getAllocatedResource

        public Resource getAllocatedResource()
        Description copied from interface: Operation
        Returns the current allocated resources for this operation or null if no resource is allocated for this operation.
        Specified by:
        getAllocatedResource in interface Operation<Resource>
        Returns:
        the current allocated resources for this operation or null
